title: bitnote

content: What are the advantages of earning merit? One of the advantages I know is that we can increase our rank by earning merit and activities.

comments.author: EFS
comments.body: Besides activity, you need merit to increase your rank. You need 1 merit for being Jr. Member, 1000 merit for Legendary member.You need to be at least Jr. Member to set signature and personal text.Your posts are highlighted with "merited by" line. You can join signature campaigns by having high number of merits.Quote from: theymos on January 24, 2018, 11:00:11 PMIn addition to activity, everyone now has a merit score, and you need both a certain activity level and a certain merit score in order to reach higher member ranks. The required scores are:RankRequired activityRequired meritBrand new00Newbie10Jr Member301Member6010Full Member120100Sr. Member240250Hero Member480500LegendaryRandom in the range 775-10301000You get merit points when someone sends you some for one of your posts. Additionally, when someone sends you merit points, half of those points can be sent by you to other people.I'm hoping that this system will increase post quality by: - Forcing people to post high-quality stuff in order to rank up. If you just post garbage, you will never get even 1 merit point, and you will therefore never be able to put links in your signature, etc. - Highlighting good posts with the "Merited by" line.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: I feel without the merit system in place, people will not put effort to improve their level of engagement and contribution. In other words, here would have been filled with garbageposts. The merit system have eradicated all that as shitty post will not even get any attention. If you observe the forum, you will notice that high ranking members post in a manner that you can actually see that they are experienced and deserve their ranks. They don't go about opening threads that lacks substance. Instead, they opening great threads and contribute to discussions meaningfully. Finally, I think earning merits regularly is a sign that you are making meaning contribution to discussions in the forum.

comments.body: Trying to understand the benefits of getting should not be your priority. Trying to make friends in an anonymous surrounding should be your goal. Unless you understand how to be a friend with those who can give you merits, you won't make any difference. Try your level best to stay active. Encourage others and help them, ensure you jave enough knowledge if not they acct you don't. The forum is the best resource of everything related to Bitcoin.

comments.author: goxcraft
comments.body: First of all, it helps you rank up. There are different ranks in bitcointalk like newbie, junior, member, full member, senior, here and legendary. And based on your rank, you may get different benefits. You have to understand what this merit system is and why it was implemented. The merit system helps reduce spam and shitty posts. It's not a 100% fool proof system, but it's still doing its work like a charm. If you compare before and after the merit system was introduced, you'll see a massive difference in post quality. Those who understand it's significant are trying so hard to earn merit and rank up. Ranking up has its own benefits. You can join different bitcoin and altcoin signature campaigns that are happening in the forum. The payroll depends on your rank. Higher ranked members get massive payments weekly. If you were a legendary member, you may get 200-250 dollars worth of BTC on average per week. Sometimes it may vary, but I think you got what I tried to tell you.

comments.author: ZAINmalik75
comments.body: Quote from: bitnote on October 13, 2023, 12:33:54 PMWhat are the advantages of earning merit? One of the advantages I know is that we can increase our rank by earning merit and activities.Other than getting your rank up, there are no meaning or purpose of the merit system, but many people here on btt judges you on the basis of merits (ranks) if you will have lower merit means lesser rank then they will might consider you newbie, but sometimes, you are not some newbie even though your rank is senior or full member but if you have 2k merits then you will be given the same respect as we gave to legendaries. Just to point out, only few people keep track of to whom, five how much respect, not every member. Because if you are newbie and made mistake then you will be based by others but if you are legendary and made some mistake while writing the post, then you will be not bashed instead you will be corrected.You might not like this, but it is what it is. And another feature of merit system is, if you have more merits w.r.t your activity then you will be preferred by many sig Compaign managers, as they will give you more priority but let me tell you, not every manager follow this rule. So, try not to go after ranks only, try to be genuine here and share your opinions and on the way, you will gain respect, with your shared opinions, and you will also gain ranks and merits too.

Quote from: bitnote on October 13, 2023, 02:50:51 PMNow I know one more reason: for getting paid more in signature campaigns.This also is not a reason why it is here. The only two genuine reason is to use it to separate ranks, aside the activity issue. With merit it means you achieved that rank with your contribution to the forum. The other one is to discourage spammers and low quality posters, once people do not get merit for there posts they get frustrated and that reduces the number of spammers.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Other than obvious purposes like ranking up, look at merits being like Facebook/Instagram/Twitter likes. The more likes(or merits in this case) you get, the more sort of 'authoritative' you are in the eyes of most. People will likely respect your opinions a lot more.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Quote from: bitnote on October 13, 2023, 02:50:51 PM. Now I know one more reason: for getting paid more in signature campaigns.This may be a reason for many members to obtain merit, but this is a misconception. Do not think that once you obtain merit and raise your rank, you will be accepted into signature campaigns immediately.Acceptance in signature campaigns is primarily linked to the quality of posts. Campaign managers primarily select members who have high quality posts, in addition to other things as well.Therefore, new members should think about writing high-quality posts and they will automatically receive merit.
